931241
1. Royal Decree: Grants 3 Royal Shield stacks to all Shadows.
Royal Shield: Decreases damage taken by 15% (stacks up to 5 times). Loses 1 stack when damaged by a skill
2. Royal Punishment: Locks on to a Phantom Thief and deals severe damage on the next turn. Removes Lock On if Raja Naga takes damage a total of 20 times from a skill
3. Royal Blessing: When any Naga (excluding user) has 25% or more of max HP
4. At the start of each turn
5. Other Nagas cannot be defeated while Raja Naga is on the field.

2. Royal Punishment: Locks on to a Phantom Thief and deals severe damage on the next turn. Removes Lock On if Raja Naga takes damage a total of 25 times from a skill
3. Royal Blessing: When any Naga (excluding user) has 25% or more of max HP
4. At the start of each turn
5. Other Nagas cannot be defeated while Raja Naga is on the field.

The Hindu king of Asuras is named Maha Vairocana
 it will gain another King's special skill at random). <color=#72C5FF>Asura</color> activates its skill every turn.
Also known as Dhritarashtra
Also known as Virudhaka
Also known as Virupaksha
Also known as Tamonten and Vaishravana in Buddhist lore
The Hindu king of Asuras is named Maha Vairocana
Angels that sound the trumpets at the time of the apocalypse. As each trumpet sounds
 based on its current HP.
 decreasing the max HP of 1 random Phantom Thief.
 granting itself the <color=#72C5FF>Horn of War</color> status for 1 turn. When this status is active
 increasing the SP cost of skills for 1 random Phantom Thief.
 decreasing the healing effects of all Phantom Thieves' skills
 Trumpeter will prepare for 1 turn before sounding the <color=#72C5FF>Horn of Ruin</color>. This will spend all stacks of <color=#72C5FF>Power of Ruin</color> to deal Almighty damage to all Phantom Thieves (increase damage based on the Attack of all Four Horsemen). Effects are based on the number of stacks of <color=#72C5FF>Power of Ruin</color> spent.
 sacrificing 50% of its own HP to revive the Four Horsemen
 but still gains effects based on the total number of <color=#72C5FF>Power of Ruin</color> stacks. The number of stacks of <color=#72C5FF>Power of Ruin</color> will increase the damage of all Shadows.

228,Saki Mitama,One of the four aspects of Shinto thought, it brings great bounty from the hunt. It is said to aid in love, profit, and growth, and can create new paths.,AAAAAA==
229,Berith,One of the 72 demons of the Goetia. Known as the Duke of Hell, he rides a gigantic horse and burns those without manners.,AAAAAA==
230,Shiisaa,A holy beast said to protect houses from evil and bring good fortune. They look similar to Shinto guardian dogs, but are actually modeled after a lion. There are many stories about it in Ryukyu lore.,AAAAAA==
231,Yaksini,A female demon in Hindu lore. Though originally a Dravidian fertility goddess, the spread of Hinduism changed perception of her to a demonic figure. Usually depicted as a nude, voluptuous female.,AAAAAA==
232,Naga,Half-snake, half-human divine beings in Hindu lore, worshipped as bringers of rain. They live in the bottoms of lakes and seas, singing and dancing when they are not fighting.,AAAAAA==
233,Sui-Ki,One of the four oni controlled by Fujiwara no Chikata, it can cause floods with the swing of its arms. In the Taiheiki, Ki no Tomoo expelled the oni by reading a Japanese poem.,AAAAAA==
234,Flauros,One of the 72 demons of the Goetia. He appears as a leopard and can see the past and future. He can control fire and burn all his adversaries to death.,AAAAAA==
235,Setanta,A brave young man in Celtic myth. After defeating a fierce guard dog, he volunteered to take its place, earning him the nickname Hound of Culann."

714072,Isis,Osiris's wife as well as his younger sister. Upon the death of her husband, she revived him with her incredible magic power. Isis is seen at many gravesites as the guardian goddess of the dead.,AAAAAA==
714081,Oni,An evil monster from Japanese lore known for its hideous visage and brute strength. They loot and plunder villages, massacring the townspeople with their iron clubs. They have horns on their heads, red skin, long claws, and razor-sharp teeth.,AAAAAA==
714082,Sui-Ki,One of the four oni controlled by Fujiwara no Chikata, it can cause floods with the swing of its arms. In the Taiheiki, Ki no Tomoo expelled the oni by reading a Japanese poem.,AAAAAA==
714083,Kin-Ki,One of the four oni controlled by Fujiwara no Chikata, its body is so hard that no weapons can penetrate it. It and its comrades fell into hell through holes that can still be found in modern Iga.,AAAAAA==
714091,Setanta,A brave young man in Celtic myth. After defeating a fierce guard dog, he volunteered to take its place, earning him the nickname Hound of Culann."

752121,Zouchouten,Also known as Virudhaka, he is the protector of the South, and is one of the four Heavenly Kings of Buddhist origin. He is the god of the five grains, and was once the chief of the gods.,AAAAAA==
752122,Koumokuten,Also known as Virupaksha, he is the protector of the West, and is one of the four Heavenly Kings of Buddhist origin. He keeps a close watch on the world with his sharp gaze.,AAAAAA==
752123,Jikokuten,Also known as Dhritarashtra, he is the protector of the East, and is one of the four Heavenly Kings of Buddhist origin. He helps maintain the security of the nation.,AAAAAA==
752124,Bishamonten,Also known as Tamonten and Vaishravana in Buddhist lore, he is the strongest of the Heavenly Kings. He protects the North and is the god of war.,AAAAAA==
753061,Oberon,The king of the fairies and Titania's husband. He is quite old but, due to a curse, his looks are that of a young boy. He often flirts with human women, which sometimes earns him a scolding from his wife.,When either Oberon or Titania is defeated, the other will be unable to act for 2 turns.
After they recover, their damage will be <color=#FF423F>significantly increased</color>.
753062,Titania,The queen of the fairies and Oberon's wife. She is derived from the Roman goddess Diana. She was later immortalized in Shakespeare's play A Midsummer Night's Dream."
